works.title: Presence of Non-Faecal Coliform Bacteria in Potable Water in Tropical Grenada.
works.abstract: Clean drinking water is an essential component for the human health. It is important to ensure that the accessible water is free from chemical and bacteriological pollutions. The development of biofilms inside water distribution pipes facilitates the propagation of mixed microbial populations and is considered the main source of planktonic bacteria...

works.title: Microbial Diversity and Antibiotic Resistance of Bacterial Isolates from Drinking Water in Grenada, West Indies
works.abstract: Introduction of resistant bacteria into the body can occur through drinking water and can contribute to the spread of resistant bacterial strains. The objective was to determine the phenotypic diversity and antibiotic resistance of bacterial species isolated from five drinking water distribution sites in True Blue Campus of St. George’s University...

works.title: Assessment of coastal water quality in Woburn Bay, Grenada West Indies, 12.0°N 61.6°W
works.abstract: Poster presents results of data analysis of water quality in tropical water column focusing on dynamics of viable microbial counts, hydrogen sulfide, ammonium, biochemical oxygen demand, copper and iron based on the 18 weeks variation analysis performed during both dry and rainy periods in 2015 in coastal water of Grenada island in West Indies.

works.title: Potential Health Risks Associated with Bathing in A Tropical Bay in Grenada, West Indies.
